page.title: 20Recent Changes In Billericay
page.content: In the past there were more residential houses than shops in the{ {High Street}. As the town grew the houses were either altered or demolished to provide shops, chain store premises and offices to satisfy the needs of a growing town. In 1947 there was{one primary {school}. Now there are{6}. All the boys wore school caps. Hardly any boys wear caps these days. They also wore shorts that came down to their knees. Nowadays most boys wear long trousers for school. In the 1960s{electricity}replaced {gas}in lighting the High Street. Billericay grew up around the junction of roads to{Chelmsford}and{ {Tilbury, London }and{Southend}. It is now a part of the{Basildon Council {District.}
